item.title: Debbie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "When its gone, you'll know what a gift love was. you'll suffer like this. So go back and fight to keep it." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description:
"Well, I have lost you; and I lost you fairly; In my own way, and with my full consent. Say what you will, kings in a tumbrel rarely Went to their deaths more proud than this one went.
Some nights of apprehension and hot weeping I will confess; but that's permitted me; Day dried my eyes; I was not one for keeping Rubbed in a cage a wing that would be free.
If I had loved you less or played you slyly I might have held you for a summer more, But at the cost of words I value highly, And no such summer as the one before.
Should I outlive this anguish, and men do, I shall have only good to say of you." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Brian Jacques
item.description: "Don't be ashamed to weep; 'tis right to grieve. Tears are only water, and flowers, trees, and fruit cannot grow without water. But there must be sunlight also. A wounded heart will heal in time, and when it does, the memory and love of our lost ones is sealed inside to comfort us." -- Brian Jacques

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Debbie add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein
